D
 Describes how to configure SDL_Config for your own needs
 Description of configurartion files syntax
F
 File which controls how SDL_Config library will be compiled
M
 Main file which contains whole SDL_Config public API
S
 SDL_Config automated test defines
 Structures in this file for internal use of library only
First, you should know, that in order to change behaviour of SDL_Config, you must make changes directly in SDL config cfg.h file, then recompile SDL_Config, and finally recompile your application.
If you don’t have the time or the will to read everything at this page, I recommend you to look at least at the following example, so you will get the feel of what is and isn’t legal to do in the current version of SDL_Config.
They don’t form part of SDL_Config API, rather than are used by test programs, to automatically determine whether SDL_Config contains bugs in tested functions.
This documentation shouldn’t be mixed with normal library API, it is documentation of internal SDL_Config structures, and as such, it’s not for normal library user.
